content:
The Shmiel Langsam Family of Drobitzka (Debica?)


From: "Howard Nightingale" <baker1@yesic.com> 
To:  
Subject: Langsam family tree. 
Date: Sun, 4 Feb 2001 10:55:55 -0500 
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 5.00.2314.1300 


  
I am new to researching my family, and by accident I came across your family tree.  I have a 
Pesel Sauerhaft who married a David (?).  They had several children, one of whom Rachel (?) 
married a Shmiel Langsam during the war.  They both died in 1942.
 
Do I have the right family tree.  If not, please point me in the direction where I may continue 
my search.
 
Thanking you in advance.
 
Howard Nightingale
_________________________________________________________________________
Date: Mon, 05 Feb 2001 15:43:43 -0500
To: "Howard Nightingale" <baker1@yesic.com>
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: Re: Langsam family tree.

Hi,
Thanks for your inquiry. I am researching ALL Langsam's in the belief it is one large family. 
The core seems to be primarily in Galicia and Slovakia. There were many Samuel (anglocized 
version of Shmiel) Langsam's in our family. Can you elaborate at all? Wife's surname (David's)?  
Where they lived? Shmiel's parents? Age? What is your source for Shmiel Langsam? Do you know of 
other Langsam's from his family?

Please stay in touch.

Good Luck!
-Moishe
_________________________________________________________________________
From: "Howard Nightingale" <baker1@yesic.com> 
To:  
Subject: Re: Langsam family tree. 
Date: Tue, 6 Feb 2001 10:01:49 -0500 
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 5.00.2314.1300 


Thank you for your answer.    The information I have on the family is as
follows:


Ephroim and Rifka Sauerhaft had four children:  
Fayge Leah (who married Aaron Adler) 
Pesel who married (David?) 
Golda ( who married Lazar Wiesenfeld) and 
Yaakov Baruch (who married Sheinder Rikel)   

Pesel and David
had  five children: Moishe, Itzik, Rifka, Reisel and Rachel (who married
Shmiel Langsam)  

Ephroim and Rifka lived in Bialoboki, Poland.  Pesel was born in Bialoboki, 
Poland and then married David (?) and moved to Drobitzka (it may be Debica).
David (?) was a farmer.


I hope that this helps.


Looking forward to your reply - maybe we are related.


Howard

Subject: Langsam
From: Howard Nightingale 
Date: Sat, November 09, 2013 11:32 am
To: 

I read your post in the most recent Jewish Gen email.

I have a Langsam in my family tree and have been unable to connect him to any other Langsam family

Pesel Sauerhaft (born in Bialoboki) married David ? and lived in Drobitzka (Debica?).   They had several children one of whom was a daughter Rachel. She married Shmiel Langsam during WWII and both perished.

Does this ring any bell?

My family comes from Manasterz, Jawornik Polski, Zagorze, Kanczuga, Gac, Jaroslaw and other shtetls in the area.

Howard Nightingale
Toronto, Ontario

Moishe, now that you mention the prior email I do remember.  I have no date of birth for Rachel.  The information on the family came from my cousins,(Shmuel Lazar Goldman was born in 1906 in Gac and Reizel Sauerhaft born in Zagorze on March 1 1907 [based on naturalization records when she came to Canada) whom  I interviewed between the early 1970s to the late 1970s.  They are now deceased.   

Howard Nightingale
